From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [im.pliˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [im.pliˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

implicar (first-person singular present implico, first-person singular preterite impliquí, past participle implicat)

  1. to imply
  2. to implicate
  3. to involve

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of implicar (first conjugation, c-qu alternation)
infinitive implicar
gerund implicant
past participle masculine feminine
singular implicat implicada
plural implicats implicades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present implico impliques implica impliquem impliqueu impliquen
imperfect implicava implicaves implicava implicàvem implicàveu implicaven
future implicaré implicaràs implicarà implicarem implicareu implicaran
preterite impliquí implicares implicà implicàrem implicàreu implicaren
conditional implicaria implicaries implicaria implicaríem implicaríeu implicarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present impliqui impliquis impliqui impliquem impliqueu impliquin
imperfect impliqués impliquessis impliqués impliquéssim impliquéssiu impliquessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — implica impliqui impliquem impliqueu impliquin
negative (no) — no impliquis no impliqui no impliquem no impliqueu no impliquin

Further reading

[edit]
  • “implicar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “implicar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “implicar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “implicar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin implicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /impliˈkaɾ/ [im.pliˈkɑɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: im‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

implicar (first-person singular present implico, first-person singular preterite impliquei, past participle implicado)

  1. to implicate, imply

Conjugation

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “implicar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “implicar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin implicāre. Doublet of empregar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [ĩ.pliˈka(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [ĩ.pliˈka(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [ĩ.pliˈka(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈkaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈkaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.pliˈka.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: im‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

implicar (first-person singular present implico, first-person singular preterite impliquei, past participle implicado)

  1. to imply
  2. to involve
  3. to implicate
  4. (transitive) to pick on [with com ‘with someone’]
    A Laura está implicando com o João.
    Laura is picking on João.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of implicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

Pluperfect implicara implicaras implicara implicáramos implicáreis implicaram
Future implicarei implicarás implicará implicaremos implicareis implicarão
Conditional implicaria implicarias implicaria implicaríamos implicaríeis implicariam

Imperative

Negative (não) não impliques não implique não impliquemos não impliqueis não impliquem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • implicação
  • implicância

Further reading

[edit]
  • “implicar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin implicāre. Doublet of emplear.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /impliˈkaɾ/ [ĩm.pliˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: im‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

implicar (first-person singular present implico, first-person singular preterite impliqué, past participle implicado)

  1. to imply, to implicate
  2. to oppose, to contradict
    Synonyms: oponer, contrariar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of implicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive implicar
gerund implicando
past participle masculine feminine
singular implicado implicada
plural implicados implicadas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of implicar (c-qu alternation)

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
with infinitive implicar dative implicarme implicarte implicarle, implicarse implicarnos implicaros implicarles, implicarse
accusative implicarme implicarte implicarlo, implicarla, implicarse implicarnos implicaros implicarlos, implicarlas, implicarse

with informal second-person singular tú imperative implica dative implícame implícate implícale implícanos not used implícales
accusative implícame implícate implícalo, implícala implícanos not used implícalos, implícalas
with informal second-person singular vos imperative implicá dative implicame implicate implicale implicanos not used implicales
accusative implicame implicate implicalo, implicala implicanos not used implicalos, implicalas
with formal second-person singular imperative implique dative implíqueme not used implíquele, implíquese implíquenos not used implíqueles
accusative implíqueme not used implíquelo, implíquela, implíquese implíquenos not used implíquelos, implíquelas
with first-person plural imperative impliquemos dative not used impliquémoste impliquémosle impliquémonos impliquémoos impliquémosles
accusative not used impliquémoste impliquémoslo, impliquémosla impliquémonos impliquémoos impliquémoslos, impliquémoslas
with informal second-person plural imperative implicad dative implicadme not used implicadle implicadnos implicaos implicadles
accusative implicadme not used implicadlo, implicadla implicadnos implicaos implicadlos, implicadlas
with formal second-person plural imperative impliquen dative implíquenme not used implíquenle implíquennos not used implíquenles, implíquense
accusative implíquenme not used implíquenlo, implíquenla implíquennos not used implíquenlos, implíquenlas, implíquense
